2006 |- | colspan="2" style="text-align:center; white-space:nowrap;"| |} '''The Big Bear Trophy''' is presented to the winner of the annual Michigan-Michigan State men's soccer game. The trophy originated in 2000 when Michigan head coach Steve Burns purchased the wooden bear sculpture to commemorate the rivalry.{{cite web|url=http://www.mgoblue.com/genrel/061709aaa.html |title=University of Michigan Official Athletic Site |publisher=Mgoblue.com |date= |accessdate=2010-08-22}} Burns said that he and Michigan State head coach Joe Baum collaborated on a trophy game because they "wanted to have some kind of trophy for this rivalry that the teams can pass back and forth. We hope that it takes a life on its own."{{cite web|url=http://www.mgoblue.com/sports/m-soccer/recaps/101500aaa.html |title=Michigan Drops Physical Game to Spartans in Double OT - University of Michigan Official Athletic Site |publisher=Mgoblue.com |date= |accessdate=2010-08-22}} == Match Results{{cite web|url=http://www.mgoblue.com/sports/m-soccer/archive/mich-m-soccer-archive.html |title=University of Michigan Official Athletic Site - Men's Soccer |publisher=Mgoblue.com |date= |accessdate=2010-08-22}}{{cite web|url=http://www.msuspartans.com/sports/m-soccer/archive/msu-m-soccer-archive.html |title=Michigan State Official Athletic Site - Men'S Soccer |publisher=Msuspartans.com |date= |accessdate=2010-08-22}} == ''Michigan State victories are shaded in ââ green, Michigan victories are shaded ââ blue, and tie games are shaded ââ gray.'' {| class="wikitable" !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Date !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Site !style="background: #e3e3e3;" colspan=2|Winning team !style="background: #e3e3e3;" colspan=2|Losing team !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Series !style="background: #e3e3e3;"|Attendance |- style="text-align:center;
